FuncDef:
The link-state down-delay-time command sets a period that an Eth-Trunk interface waits before changing its state to Down.
The undo link-state down-delay-time command deletes the period that an Eth-Trunk interface waits before changing its state to Down.
By default, a Down Eth-Trunk interface changes its state to Down immediately without any delay.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a period that an Eth-Trunk interface waits before changing its state to Down.
The value is a multiple of 100, ranging from 0 to 1000, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set a period that an Eth-Trunk interface waits before changing its state to Down, run the link-state down-delay-time command in the Eth-Trunk interface view. The Eth-Trunk interface then changes its state to Down after the period elapses.
Precautions
After an Eth-Trunk interface is shut down using the shutdown command, the link-state down-delay-time command does not take effect for this interface.
